info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 3:44PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Garfield...northwestern Kane and southeastern Iron Counties through 415 PM MDT... At 343 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles south of Panguitch Lake, or 26 miles east of Cedar City, moving south at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southwestern Garfield...northwestern Kane and southeastern Iron Counties. This includes US Route 89 between mile markers 98 and 100. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
